name: Attruby

ingredients.name: POLYVINYL ALCOHOL GRAFT POLYETHYLENE GLYCOL COPOLYMER (3:1; 45000 MW)

indications.text: attruby indicated treatment cardiomyopathy wild-type variant transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis ( attr-cm ) adults reduce cardiovascular death cardiovascular-related hospitalization .

contraindications.text: recommended attruby 712 mg orally twice daily . ( 2.1 )

warningsAndPrecautions: attruby ( acoramidis ) tablets , 356 mg , white , film-coated , oval tablets , printed bridgebio company logo followed “ acor ” black ink one side . attruby tablets supplied carton 112 tablets : 4 blister cards ( containing 28 tablets ) – ( ndc 82228-712-28 ) . store attruby controlled room temperature 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . store original blister card protect moisture .
indications_original: ATTRUBY is indicated for the treatment of the cardiomyopathy of wild-type or variant transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis (ATTR-CM) in adults to reduce cardiovascular death and cardiovascular-related hospitalization.
contraindications_original: The recommended dosage of ATTRUBY is 712 mg orally twice daily. ( 2.1 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
ATTRUBY (acoramidis) tablets, 356 mg, are white, film-coated, oval tablets, printed with the BridgeBio company logo followed by “ACOR” in black ink on one side.

                  ATTRUBY tablets are supplied as a carton of 112 tablets: 4 blister cards (each containing 28 tablets)– (NDC 82228-712-28).

                  Store ATTRUBY at controlled room temperature 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Store in original blister card until use to protect from moisture.
